gui

Class BoardUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.BoardUtilities

  • public class BoardUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class for finding out information about the current chess board position
    Author:
    Daniele Palazzo

      • checkForKnightCheck

        private static java.util.List<Knight> checkForKnightCheck(BoardCoordinate square,
                                                          PlayerColour perspective)
        Checks whether or not one or more Knights are giving a check to the square in question and returns a list of the checking pieces.
        Parameters:
        square - The square that will be examined for Knight checks
        perspective - Check if the square is in check from this side's perspective
        Returns:
        Returns the list of Knights that are giving a check to the square in question

      • checkHorizontallyAndVerticallyForCheck

        private static java.util.List<Piece> checkHorizontallyAndVerticallyForCheck(BoardCoordinate square,
                                                                            PlayerColour perspective,
                                                                            Piece King)
        Checks whether or not the square in question is in check by a horizontally or vertically aligned piece and returns a list of the checking pieces.
        Parameters:
        square - The square that will be examined for checks
        perspective - Check if the square is in check from this side's perspective
        King - The king to ignore in the search (i.e. the king cannot block off the square from being checked)
        Returns:
        Returns the list of Pieces that are giving a check to the square in question

      • checkDiagonallyForCheck

        private static java.util.List<Piece> checkDiagonallyForCheck(BoardCoordinate square,
                                                             PlayerColour perspective,
                                                             Piece King)
        Checks whether or not the square in question is in check by a diagonally aligned piece and returns a list of the checking pieces.
        Parameters:
        square - The square that will be examined for checks
        perspective - Check if the square is in check from this side's perspective
        King - The king to ignore in the search (i.e. the king cannot block off the square from being checked)
        Returns:
        Returns the list of Pieces that are giving a check to the square in question

      • coordinatesAreAdjecent

        public static boolean coordinatesAreAdjecent(BoardCoordinate c1,
                                             BoardCoordinate c2)
        Checks if two coordinates are adjacent to each other
        Parameters:
        c1 - First coordinate to compare
        c2 - Second coordinate to compare
        Returns:
        Returns true if the coordinates are adjacent

      • getSquareCheckingPieces

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getSquareCheckingPieces(BoardCoordinate square,
                                                                 PlayerColour perspective,
                                                                 Piece King)
        Gets all the pieces that are giving a check to the square in question
        Parameters:
        square - The square that will be examined for checks
        perspective - Check if the square is in check from this side's perspective
        King - The king to ignore in the search (i.e. the king cannot block off the square from being checked)
        Returns:
        Return the list of pieces that are giving a check to the square

      • isSquareInCheck

        public static boolean isSquareInCheck(BoardCoordinate square,
                                      PlayerColour perspective,
                                      Piece King)
        Determines whether or not a square is in check
        Parameters:
        square - The square in question.
        perspective - Check if the square is in check from this side's perspective
        King - The king to ignore in the search (i.e. the king cannot block off the square from being checked)
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square is in check by at least 1 pieces

      • isSquareInBetween

        public static boolean isSquareInBetween(BoardCoordinate square,
                                        BoardCoordinate square1,
                                        BoardCoordinate square2)
        Determines whether a square is in between two other squares
        Parameters:
        square - The square in question.
        square1 - Square 1
        square2 - Square 2
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square in question is in between square 1 and 2

      • isAnyPieceInBetween

        public static boolean isAnyPieceInBetween(BoardCoordinate square1,
                                          BoardCoordinate square2)
        Determines whether there is a piece in between two squares
        Parameters:
        square1 - Square 1
        square2 - Square 2
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is at least 1 piece in between the two board coordinates (squares)

      • coordinatesAreEqual

        public static boolean coordinatesAreEqual(BoardCoordinate c1,
                                          BoardCoordinate c2)
        Checks whether the passed in coordinates are equal
        Parameters:
        c1 - coordinate 1
        c2 - coordinate 2
        Returns:
        Returns true if coordinate 1 and 2 are equal
